alert.note: Alert for Lac qui Parle (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 11:24AM CDT until April 13 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... West BR Lac qui Parle River at Dawson affecting Lac qui Parle County. .While the river level has dropped just below flood stage at Dawson, the warning continues for the rest of today as more snowmelt flow continues. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West BR Lac qui Parle River at Dawson. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow. * IMPACTS...At 39.7 feet, Water surface hits Diagonal St Bridge * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 830 PM CDT Tuesday, the stage was 37.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain near 39.0 feet this afternoon, then slowly drop below 38 feet tonight. - Flood stage is 39.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 38.2 feet on 04/25/2018. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
